com.github.amlcurran.showcaseview

Class ShowcaseView.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.amlcurran.showcaseview.ShowcaseView.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    ShowcaseView

    public static class ShowcaseView.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder class which allows easier creation of ShowcaseViews. It is recommended that you use this Builder class.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private android.app.Activity activity 
      private android.view.ViewGroup parent 
      private int parentIndex 
      private ShowcaseView showcaseView

      Deprecated. 
      use withHoloShowcase(), withNewStyleShowcase(), or setShowcaseDrawer(ShowcaseDrawer)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(android.app.Activity activity)

      • Builder

        @Deprecated
public Builder(android.app.Activity activity,
                           boolean useNewStyle)
        Deprecated. use withHoloShowcase(), withNewStyleShowcase(), or setShowcaseDrawer(ShowcaseDrawer)
        Parameters:
        useNewStyle - should use "new style" showcase (see withNewStyleShowcase()

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public ShowcaseView build()
        Create the ShowcaseView and show it.
        Returns:
        the created ShowcaseView

      • withHoloShowcase

        public ShowcaseView.Builder withHoloShowcase()
        Draw a holo-style showcase. This is the default.

      • withNewStyleShowcase

        public ShowcaseView.Builder withNewStyleShowcase()
        Draw a new-style showcase.

      • withMaterialShowcase

        public ShowcaseView.Builder withMaterialShowcase()
        Draw a material style showcase.

      • setShowcaseDrawer

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setShowcaseDrawer(ShowcaseDrawer showcaseDrawer)
        Set a custom showcase drawer which will be responsible for measuring and drawing the showcase

      • setContentTitle

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setContentTitle(int resId)
        Set the title text shown on the ShowcaseView.

      • setContentTitle

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setContentTitle(java.lang.CharSequence title)
        Set the title text shown on the ShowcaseView.

      • setContentText

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setContentText(int resId)
        Set the descriptive text shown on the ShowcaseView.

      • setContentText

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setContentText(java.lang.CharSequence text)
        Set the descriptive text shown on the ShowcaseView.

      • setTarget

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setTarget(Target target)
        Set the target of the showcase.
        Parameters:
        target - a Target representing the item to showcase (e.g., a button, or action item).

      • setStyle

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setStyle(int theme)
        Set the style of the ShowcaseView. See the sample app for example styles.

      • setOnClickListener

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setOnClickListener(android.view.View.OnClickListener onClickListener)
        Set a listener which will override the button clicks.

        Note that you will have to manually hide the ShowcaseView

      • doNotBlockTouches

        public ShowcaseView.Builder doNotBlockTouches()
        Don't make the ShowcaseView block touches on itself. This doesn't block touches in the showcased area.

        By default, the ShowcaseView does block touches

      • hideOnTouchOutside

        public ShowcaseView.Builder hideOnTouchOutside()
        Make this ShowcaseView hide when the user touches outside the showcased area. This enables doNotBlockTouches() as well.

        By default, the ShowcaseView doesn't hide on touch.

      • singleShot

        public ShowcaseView.Builder singleShot(long shotId)
        Set the ShowcaseView to only ever show once.
        Parameters:
        shotId - a unique identifier (across the app) to store whether this ShowcaseView has been shown.

      • setShowcaseEventListener

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setShowcaseEventListener(OnShowcaseEventListener showcaseEventListener)

      • setParent

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setParent(android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                      int index)

      • setContentTextPaint

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setContentTextPaint(android.text.TextPaint textPaint)
        Sets the paint that will draw the text as specified by setContentText(CharSequence) or setContentText(int). If you're using a TextAppearance (set by setStyle(int), then this TextPaint will override that TextAppearance.

      • setContentTitlePaint

        public ShowcaseView.Builder setContentTitlePaint(android.text.TextPaint textPaint)
        Sets the paint that will draw the text as specified by setContentTitle(CharSequence) or setContentTitle(int). If you're using a TextAppearance (set by setStyle(int), then this TextPaint will override that TextAppearance.

      • replaceEndButton

        public ShowcaseView.Builder replaceEndButton(android.widget.Button button)
        Replace the end button with the one provided. Note that this resets any OnClickListener provided by View.setOnClickListener(OnClickListener), so call this method before that one.

      • replaceEndButton

        public ShowcaseView.Builder replaceEndButton(int buttonResourceId)
        Replace the end button with the one provided. Note that this resets any OnClickListener provided by View.setOnClickListener(OnClickListener), so call this method before that one.

      • blockAllTouches

        public ShowcaseView.Builder blockAllTouches()
        Block any touch made on the ShowcaseView, even inside the showcase

      • useDecorViewAsParent

        public ShowcaseView.Builder useDecorViewAsParent()
        Uses the android decor view to insert a showcase, this is not recommended as then UI elements in showcase view can hide behind the nav bar
